subject: RE: [junit] Re: how to use ExceptionTestCase ?
msgSnippet: ... I would feel honored! 8-) Will that article be available online? ... Ah, I do know it as Essential Java Style (amazon.de, too). I don t own it, but took
messageBody:
> >> This is very excellent.
> >
> >Well, it seems to be as good as it can get in Java... ;)
> >
> >Thanks anyway!
>
> I hope you don't mind that I'm using it (credit to you of
> course) in an article.

I would feel honored! 8-)

Will that article be available online?


> >> Did you just read Jeff Langr's
> >> "Implementation Patterns for Java" book or something? :) I
> >> never saw the connection before now.
> >
> >I don't even know that book - is it recommendable?
> >
> >If you want to attribute it to a book, it's rather
> stimulated by Beck's
> >"Smalltalk Best Practice Patterns".
>
> Langr's book was, too. It's a good one to have on the shelf
> so that you can recommend it to others. It's worth a read.
> You may know most of it, but you probably don't know all of it. :)

Ah, I do know it as "Essential Java Style" (amazon.de, too). I don't own
it, but took a look at it some time ago (was in the library of a former
employer). Somehow I remember enyoing SBPP more...

Regards, Ilja
